title: JPMorgan Chase Reports Record $55 Billion Profit for 2025
introText: JPMorgan Chase has reported record annual profits of $55 billion, cementing its position as America's most profitable bank. Strong trading revenue, investment banking fees, and net interest income drove the exceptional results.

content.content: JPMorgan's $55 billion profit represents a 20% increase from 2024 and sets a new record for any American bank. CEO Jamie Dimon credited the bank's diversified business model and disciplined risk management.
Return on equity reached 18%, well above the industry average and the bank's own cost of capital.
Investment banking fees surged 40% as capital markets activity rebounded. Trading revenue benefited from market volatility, with fixed income and equity desks both posting strong results.
Consumer banking profits grew despite rate cuts, as deposit franchise and credit card business remained strong.
JPMorgan announced a 10% dividend increase and $30 billion share repurchase authorization. The bank's stock has gained 45% in 2025, reaching all-time highs.
